main event: A military observer reported a sighting of an object identified as ECHO II over the Pacific Ocean on October 19, 1966.
interesting points: The object was described as shiny and about the size of a pea,The observation lasted for 9 minutes,The object moved across the sky at a constant altitude and heading toward the NNE, The sighting was conducted using binoculars,The conclusion identified the object as a satellite.
sighted object: a shiny object in the sky
